decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to use the Cascade mechanic to efficiently cast Living End and reset the battlefield, while also cycling through the deck to find key combo pieces. The deck utilizes low-cost cycling creatures like Architects of Will, Street Wraith, and Curator of Mysteries, along with cascade enablers like Shardless Agent and Violent Outburst. It also includes disruption and counter magic with Force of Negation to protect the combo. The deck aims to control the game until it can set up a favorable board state and then win with powerful creatures like Otawara, Soaring City and Oliphaunt.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It uses cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to search for these lands efficiently. The deck aims to control the game by using cards like Karn, the Great Creator, Oblivion Stone, and Wurmcoil Engine to disrupt the opponent's strategy and survive until it can cast big threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. It also utilizes artifacts like Expedition Map and Relic of Progenitus for additional utility and card advantage.

The key concept of this deck revolves around the combo potential of Indomitable Creativity and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. By casting Indomitable Creativity, the player can exile their own artifacts (such as Dwarven Mine) and enchantments (such as Leyline Binding) to then reveal cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. This creature card is then put onto the battlefield, creating a powerful board presence. The deck also utilizes cards like Wrenn and Six, Archon of Cruelty, and Teferi, Time Raveler for value and disruption.

The key concept of this Amulet Titan deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces - Amulet of Vigor, Simic Growth Chamber, and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove - to generate a large amount of mana and play Primeval Titan multiple times in a turn. With the help of Summoner's Pact and Tolaria West, the deck can consistently tutor for Primeval Titan and key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The Mycosynth Gardens to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Slayers' Stronghold to protect and enhance Primeval Titan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Amulet Titan. The deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana with cards like Arboreal Grazer, Dryad of the Ilysian Grove, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking. It also utilizes Primeval Titan to search for key lands like Vesuva, Boseiju, Who Endures, and the Mycosynth Gardens. The deck also includes cards like Amulet of Vigor and Urza's Saga to generate additional value and advantage. Ultimately, the goal is to set up a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck, based on the Aggro - Jund archetype, focuses on aggressive strategies and quick victories. It utilizes a combination of powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, Orcish Bowmasters, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Questing Druid. The deck also includes disruptive cards such as Dauthi Voidwalker, Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's plans. Removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Molten Collapse help eliminate threats while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides card advantage. The deck is supported by a mana base consisting of various land cards like Blood Crypt, Verdant Catacombs, and Castle Locthwain.
